translation.en: [woman] I'm really worried about him.
[man] Me too. I've never seen him this upset.
translation.es: Yo también. Nunca lo había visto así.

translation.en: -[woman] I know. -[man] He's taking it hard.
[woman] You know what he said to me? He said he'll never write another story ever again.
translation.es: ¿Sabes qué me dijo? Que jamás volverá a escribir un cuento.

translation.en: -[man] He said that? -[woman] Yeah.
[crying] This is lame! Stupid!
I'm gonna burn all this stupid stuff!
[woman] I'm so afraid that tonight is gonna, like, stifle him
translation.es: LOS MUCHACHOS PERDIDOS Temo que esto lo desanime o que sea una herida que lo atormente.

translation.en: or be this wound that haunts him.
translation.es: Temo que esto lo desanime o que sea una herida que lo atormente.

translation.en: Poor little guy.
[man] He's a creative kid, but maybe we let his obsession with horror get out of hand.
translation.es: Es creativo, pero está demasiado obsesionado con el terror.

translation.en: [man] I guess I can see how they could consider it a little weird.
translation.es: Entiendo que les parezca un poco raro.

translation.en: Maybe it would be easier if he was just more, I don't know, normal.
translation.es: Tal vez sería más fácil si fuera más, no lo sé, normal.

translation.en: [woman] I think I heard something.
Alex?
I didn't hear anything.
[man 1 on TV] It was all gonna be so perfect, Lucy…
[man 1 on TV] …just like one big, happy family.
Your boys
and my boys.
[boy on TV] Great. The bloodsucking Brady Bunch.
[Alex] Lost Boys?
I still want you, Lucy.
[man 1 on TV] I haven't changed my mind about that.
[man 2 on TV] I didn't invite you this time, Max. [Lucy] Michael.
translation.es: - No te invité esta vez, Max. - Michael.

translation.en: Michael!
-[boy] Don't you touch my mother! -[Lucy] Sam, don't! No, Sam!
translation.es: - ¡No toques a mi madre! - Sam, ¡no! ¡No, Sam!

translation.en: Where am I?
-[door rattles] -Hello?
Hello?
Anyone? I'm trapped!
Mom!
Dad!
-Hello? Help! -[electricity buzzes]
[woman] What is your name?
A… Alex.
[woman whispers] Alex.
-[Alex gasps] -[woman] Alex!
[gasps, yelps] Please, please.
Let's get this over with. I'm a busy witch. Are you useful in any way?
translation.es: Vamos, soy una bruja ocupada. ¿Sirves para algo?

translation.en: Uh, I… [grunts]
Do you see them?
The apartment lured them in.
That's what the apartment does.
Those children, they were not useful to me.
translation.es: Esos niños no eran de utilidad para mí.

translation.en: Do you understand? So let's try this again.
Is there anything special about you at all? Any reason I should let you live?
translation.es: ¿Tienes algo especial? ¿Algo por lo que debería dejarte vivir?

translation.en: -And get up. -[whooshing]
[witch] Come closer.
Goodbye, Alex.
[hesitates] I do write scary stories.
Did you say "scary stories"?
What's… what's that?
No more questions. My Nightbooks. It's where I wrote my stories.
translation.es: - Basta de preguntas. - Mis libretas. Aquí escribía mis cuentos.

translation.en: What are you doing with these so late at night? I was…
translation.es: - ¿Qué hacías con esto tan tarde? - Iba a…

translation.en: I was gonna burn them in the boiler room downstairs. Burn them? So they're not any good.
translation.es: - Iba a quemarlas en la caldera. - ¿Qué? Entonces no son buenos.

translation.en: -No. -Goodbye, Alex.
They're good. They're very, really, really good.
Nightbooks, huh?
The title better not be the scariest thing about them. I'm going to need a story every night.
translation.es: Espero que sean realmente aterradores. Necesitaré un cuento por noche.

translation.en: The story better be good, and it better be scary,
translation.es: Más te vale que escribas algo bueno y espeluznante,

translation.en: or it's the last thing you'll ever do. [giggles]
translation.es: o será lo último que hagas.

translation.en: [breathing shakily] Hey.
-[meows] -[Alex] It's a little kitty.
Mischievous little thing.
How'd you get in here? -[hissing] -[Alex screaming]
[Alex] What is this place?
Where's the TV?
[Alex] And where'd the front door go?
Oh my God.
You scared me.
What?
-[Alex] You're a kid. -[girl] And you're a genius.
translation.es: - ¿Qué? - Eres una niña. Y tú, un genio.

translation.en: I'm Alex. Who are you?
[sighs] You're gonna be chatty. Great.
I'm Yasmin.
Are you a prisoner too? No, I'm on vacation.
Okay, food's here. Hope you like peanut butter.
translation.es: Aquí hay comida. Espero que te guste la mantequilla de maní.

translation.en: I used to.
Anything in these cabinets is off-limits.
Don't ever think Natacha won't miss this piece of popcorn.
translation.es: Natacha sabrá si comiste una palomita.

translation.en: -Lenore tells her everything. -[Lenore growls]
Come out, you evil skin-bag.
[Alex] And that's the invisible cat?
You say cat. I say Natacha's little spy-beast.
translation.es: Tú dices "gata", para mí es la espía de Natacha.

translation.en: And Natacha is…
Keep up. Natacha is the witch.
Lenore is that wrinkled, hairless thing that follows you around all day, popping up out of nowhere.
translation.es: Lenore es la cosa arrugada y calva que te sigue y aparece de la nada.

translation.en: She ratted me out over a stinking cup of noodles. I hate that cat.
translation.es: Me delató por unos tontos fideos. La odio.

translation.en: Don't just stand there. Help me clean this up before Natacha gets home.
translation.es: Limpiemos antes de que Natacha vuelva.

translation.en: Where is she, Natacha?
I don't know where she goes or what she does, but she can go anywhere she wants.
translation.es: No sé qué hace, pero puede ir adonde quiera.

translation.en: Talk about the ultimate passport, this apartment is it.
translation.es: El departamento es el mejor pasaporte.

translation.en: Come on. We both have work to do. I'll get you set up.
Ultimate passport?
The apartment travels all over the world, luring kids in.
translation.es: El departamento viaja y atrae niños.

translation.en: I'm from New York. Brooklyn. I live in Washington. Washington, DC.
translation.es: - Soy de Nueva York. De Brooklyn. - Yo vivo en Washington D. C.

translation.en: Or I did before.
I wonder if we're still in Brooklyn.
The apartment moves? When it needs fresh meat.
translation.es: - ¿Esto se mueve? - Si necesita carne fresca.

translation.en: Not literally. Jeez.
Thought you wrote scary stories.
Not anymore.
Ta-da.
This is so cool.
[echoing] How is…
I mean, wow!
It can't be.
Hello!
How is this even possible? The apartment can do two things.
translation.es: - ¿Cómo es posible? - El departamento hace dos cosas.

translation.en: It lures suckers like us in, and it has room to hold…
translation.es: Atrae a tontos como nosotros y tiene espacio…

translation.en: This is so cool.
…well, anything.
The Empty Classroom and Other Creepy Stories. Nightdreams and Daymares.
translation.es: El aula vacía y otros cuentos. Sueños y pesadillas.

translation.en: Whispered Tales. She does like stories.
translation.es: Cuentos susurrados. Sí que le gustan los cuentos.

translation.en: I thought you said you weren't into that kinda stuff anymore.
translation.es: Dijiste que ya no te gustaba todo eso.

translation.en: -I'm not. It's my friend. -Oh, it's your friend?
translation.es: - A mí no, a un amigo. - ¿Un amigo?

translation.en: He, uh… he'd like all this stuff.
translation.es: A él le gustaría todo esto.

translation.en: But me? Nah.
-He's, like… he's really lame. -Yeah, he sounds lame.
translation.es: - Es que él es ñoño. - Suena ñoño.

translation.en: Hmm. Cool. Okay, yeah.
So she makes me read her a stupid scary story every night,
translation.es: Todas las noches debo leerle un tonto cuento de terror,

translation.en: but she says everything in here's already been read.
Everything?
Good thing you're a storyteller.
She needs you, so get to work. You heard her. She wants a scary story tonight.
translation.es: Te necesita. Ponte a trabajar. Ya la oíste, quiere un cuento aterrador.

translation.en: Every day, write as many stories as you can.
I don't write--
Cut the crap. I heard you last night, talking about your Nightbook thingies.
translation.es: No mientas. Te oí hablar de tus libretas anoche.

translation.en: Oh, those.
I'm over the whole writing thing.
Then you better get over getting over it and crank out some new tales, 'cause if you don't--
translation.es: Espero que lo superes y escribas algo nuevo, si no…

translation.en: She'll kill me. I know.
You'll be lucky if she kills you.
This is your life now.
Forget your family. Forget your friends. Focus on being useful to Natacha.
translation.es: Olvida a tu familia, a tus amigos. Debes ser útil para Natacha.

translation.en: You wanna live?
Write scary stories.
I'm not gonna write anything, 'cause I'm getting out of here.
translation.es: ¡No escribiré nada porque saldré de aquí!

translation.en: [Yasmin] You're gonna die.
[Alex] Come on, open.
Where are you?
Another exit.
Damn.
Every time.
You all try and run.
There's no escape.
You understand?
[distorted] You understand?
Hmm. Were you purposely making me wait?
-No. I… I was doing the dishes. -Sit there.
-Should I just start reading? -[Lenore purring]
Give me a minute to get settled. I mean, honestly!
translation.es: Dame un minuto para acomodarme. ¡Por favor!

translation.en: What is that?
Do you know what happens to children who ask too many questions?
translation.es: ¿Sabes qué les pasa a los niños preguntones?

translation.en: Do you wanna find out?
So, Storyteller,
you tried to escape today.
Yasmin, too, had a little rebellious streak.
translation.es: Yasmin también era un poco rebelde.

translation.en: But I am curious about one thing.
translation.es: Pero hay algo que me da curiosidad.

translation.en: Why burn your stories?
What is that?
Read. Now.
[Alex] "When… when Todd's best friend Jenny died, his heart shattered into a thousand pieces."
translation.es: "Cuando su amiga Jenny murió, a Todd se le rompió el corazón".

translation.en: Shattered heart? I like it already.
[Alex] "Everyone avoided the Foster Playground at night." "They all knew the legend."
translation.es: "Todos evitaban el parque de noche: conocían la leyenda.

translation.en: "In the hour before daylight, the dead kids would come out and play."
translation.es: A la madrugada, los niños muertos"…

translation.en: Nope. No, no, no. Sorry, nope.
Everyone knows that ghosts haunt places that are personal to them, not public places.
translation.es: Los fantasmas están en lugares especiales para ellos, no en lugares públicos.

translation.en: Uh, are… are you sure?
I'm sure.
Get on with it.
[Alex] "Todd walks to the playground. He gets to the gate."
translation.es: "Todd se acerca al parque. Llega a la verja.

translation.en: "And as soon as his foot crosses the threshold,
translation.es: En cuanto su pie cruza el umbral,

translation.en: children…"
-[Todd gasping] -[Alex] "…squealing, playing."
"Suddenly, a boy shoots out of the slide."
translation.es: De repente, un niño sale del tobogán.

translation.en: "Maybe he's ten or so, dressed like a newsie from the '20s."
translation.es: Parece un vendedor de diarios de los años 20.

translation.en: Rude. You could at least say hi. Hey… hey. I… I mean… I mean hi.
I'm looking for my friend, Jenny.
[Alex] "…Todd says, while looking for any sign of her."
translation.es: Todd busca algún rastro de ella.

translation.en: To find her, you have to play.
[Alex] "The newsie whistles, and half a dozen dead kids surround Todd."
translation.es: El chico silba, y seis niños rodean a Todd.

translation.en: "Their skin is deathly white. Some of their clothes date back decades."
translation.es: Están muy pálidos. Algunos tienen ropa de hace décadas.

translation.en: "They push Todd on a swing, higher and higher--"
translation.es: Empujan a Todd en un columpio"…

translation.en: [Natacha] Stupid!
Everyone knows ghosts don't have actual physical hands,
translation.es: Todos saben que los fantasmas no tienen manos,

translation.en: so they could never push him on a swing.
Amateur.
The playground is… it's an interdimensional plane, a mix between the spirit world and the real world.
translation.es: Este es un plano interdimensional entre el mundo espiritual y el real.

translation.en: Oh, so you're a quantum physicist now?
-Whatever. Continue. -[Lenore meows]
[hesitates] "And then the children laugh, and they pull Todd to a rusty merry-go-round."
translation.es: "Los niños se ríen y arrastran a Todd a un carrusel oxidado.

translation.en: "They spin him around and around, faster and faster,
translation.es: Lo hacen girar y girar cada vez más rápido.

translation.en: making Todd dizzier and dizzier."
"Then the ghosts force Todd onto a seesaw." "He holds on tight."
translation.es: Luego lo llevan al subibaja. Todd se aferra a él.

translation.en: "Suddenly, Todd realizes what they're up to."
"Any living child still on the playground when the sun rises
translation.es: si sigue en el parque al amanecer,

translation.en: is cursed to remain there forever."
"He stumbles towards the gate, desperate to get out, but his world is spinning, and he's tripping over his own feet."
translation.es: Va hacia la verja, desesperado por huir, pero todo da vueltas y se tropieza.

translation.en: "The sun's almost up. He's nearly out of time."
translation.es: El sol va a salir. No queda tiempo.

translation.en: "All the ghost children watch in suspense."
"Todd's not going to make it." "Until suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him towards the exit."
translation.es: Todd no sobrevivirá. De pronto, alguien lo empuja a la salida.

translation.en: "It's Jenny!"
"'Jenny, I… I wanted to see you.'"
"'Get out of here,' Jenny says, not stopping for a happy reunion."
translation.es: '¡Vete!', dice ella. No hay tiempo para reencuentros.

translation.en: "Seeing his old friend again makes Todd's heart hurt."
translation.es: Ver a su amiga le parte el alma.

translation.en: I miss you. I don't wanna let you go.
[Alex] "But in death, Jenny discovered something that Todd is about to learn."
translation.es: Pero Jenny descubrió algo que Todd aún no sabe.

translation.en: Friends never let go, Todd. [Alex] "Because friends never forget."
translation.es: 'Los amigos nunca se van, Todd, porque los amigos nunca se olvidan.

translation.en: [Jenny] I'll always be with you,
here.
A happy ending?
-[meows] -[distorted] Are you out of your mind? No happy endings, you fool.
translation.es: ¿Estás loco? No hay finales felices, tonto.

translation.en: Jenny… Jenny's dead. She's… she's trapped on the playground forever.
translation.es: Jenny está muerta, atrapada en el parque.

translation.en: -It's not happy for her. -[Natacha breathing heavily]
[spluttering] Ghostly hands go on Todd's back.
translation.es: Unas manos fantasmales tocan a Todd.

translation.en: He… he… he glances behind him,
and he's pulled into the playground.
translation.es: y lo jalan hacia el parque.

translation.en: He… he screams for help, but it's no use. His ghostly soul is trapped there to this very day.
translation.es: Pide ayuda a gritos, pero es inútil. Su alma fantasmal queda atrapada ahí.

translation.en: [breathlessly] Happy endings are a dangerous thing.
Never forget that.
Did you at least like the story? I mean, until the ending?
translation.es: ¿Pero te gustó la historia? ¿Hasta el final?

translation.en: [sighs] Writers, always so insecure.
You're still alive, aren't you?
I'm mystified by you, Storyteller.
This beautiful darkness dances inside your brain.
translation.es: Esta hermosa oscuridad baila dentro de tu mente.

translation.en: You should celebrate it.
But you run from it. Why?
I just…
[sighs] I… I wanna be like everyone else.
You wrote all this today? Uh, I had… I had trouble writing today.
translation.es: - ¿Escribiste todo esto hoy? - Me costó escribir hoy.

translation.en: What?
It's just hard to concentrate with someone staring at me all day.
translation.es: Es difícil concentrarse cuando te están mirando.

translation.en: I told you, show him the library and then get out.
translation.es: Te dije: "Muéstrale la biblioteca y vete".

translation.en: Wait! Wait!
Not her! Not her.
You were disturbing him. -[meows] -It is very important that he writes.
translation.es: Lo estuviste molestando. Es muy importante que escriba.

translation.en: You know how important it is.
Wait!
It… it wasn't her fault either.
Well, if it wasn't Yasmin's fault, and it wasn't Lenore's fault,
translation.es: Bueno, si no fue Yasmin ni Lenore,

translation.en: then whose fault was it?
Mine. I'll… I'll write faster.
[Natacha] Lenore won't bother you again. No more excuses, Storyteller.
translation.es: Lenore no te molestará. Ya no tienes excusas, Cuentacuentos.

translation.en: [sighs] Are you okay?
Leave me alone.
[splutters] Yasmin, I'm sorry.
I wasn't trying to get you in any kind of trouble.
translation.es: No quería meterte en problemas. Yasmin, lo siento.

translation.en: Yasmin, I'm sorry. I didn't know about the "no happy endings" thing.
translation.es: No quería meterte en problemas. Yasmin, lo siento. No sabía lo de los finales felices.

translation.en: Todd shouldn't have gone back for Jenny.
translation.es: Todd fue a buscar a Jenny.

translation.en: -He was stupid. -No, he wasn't.
translation.es: - Fue un idiota. - No es así.

translation.en: He was her friend, and that's what friends do. Maybe in fairy tales.
translation.es: - Eso hacen los amigos. - Quizá en los cuentos de hadas.

translation.en: But in here? She's right, you know.
Happy endings don't exist.
What?
What… what is that?
This place sucks.
She wants stories? Fine. I'll give her some stories.
Yes! Yes, a haunted desk! Haunted by the spirit of somebody who died working at it.
translation.es: Un escritorio embrujado con el espíritu de quien murió trabajando ahí.

translation.en: No, no, it's stupid. They're gonna think it's stupid.
translation.es: No, es tonto. Les parecerá tonto.

translation.en: How long you been here for? Looks like a while.
translation.es: ¿Cuánto tiempo llevas aquí? Parece que bastante.

translation.en: How'd they get you? They got me with a piece of pie and Lost Boys.
translation.es: ¿Cómo te atrapó? A mí, con pastel y Los muchachos perdidos.

translation.en: Once upon a time,
Alex stared up at the ceiling.
Then the ceiling fell on him
translation.es: Luego el techo se cayó sobre él

translation.en: and put him out of his misery.
The end.
What's up there?
It's the oldest book in here. This thing's gotta be, like, a thousand years old.
translation.es: Es el libro más antiguo que hay aquí. Debe tener como mil años.

translation.en: "Kinder und Hausmärchen."
"Rumpelstiltskin."
"Sleeping Beauty"?
"Hansel and Gretel."
Is that a ballpoint pen?
Wow. "Frankenstein."
Oh my God.
It's writing.
"If I don't make it out of here, I need someone to know what happened,
translation.es: "Necesito que alguien sepa qué me pasó,

translation.en: even if it's only the characters in these books."
translation.es: aunque solo sean los personajes de estos libros.

translation.en: "I saw a unicorn." "People said they didn't exist, but there it was."
translation.es: Vi un unicornio. Dicen que no existen, pero ahí estaba.

translation.en: "I followed it into this apartment, and now I'm trapped by a witch."
translation.es: Lo seguí hasta el departamento, y una bruja me atrapó.

translation.en: "She's mean and scary."
"I just have to do what the witch tells me to until Mom and Dad find me."
translation.es: "Debo hacer lo que diga hasta que mamá y papá me encuentren.

translation.en: "There are other kids here. Most of them are nice." "I'm scared, but at least I'm not alone."
translation.es: Hay otros niños. La mayoría son buenos. Tengo miedo, pero no estoy sola".

translation.en: Dinner in an hour. Hey, Yasmin, do you like unicorns?
translation.es: - Cenamos en una hora. - Oye, Yasmin, ¿te gustan los unicornios?

translation.en: Yeah, 'cause that's so me. Oh, I thought maybe that's how she got you.
translation.es: - Sí, porque ese es mi estilo. - Pensé que quizá te había atrapado así.

translation.en: Natacha, I mean.
You're right. It's none of my business.
And I bet you weren't lured in by a stupid movie and a piece of pie.
translation.es: Seguro no te atrajo con una tonta película y pastel.

translation.en: Stupid pumpkin pie.
Fine.
It was doro wat.
What the hell is doro wat?
Chicken, onions caramelized in spiced butter, paprika, garlic,
translation.es: Pollo, cebolla caramelizada en mantequilla, pimentón, ajo,

translation.en: ginger, berbere spice.
My āyatē… My grandmother and I used to make it before she died.
translation.es: Mi ayate… Mi abuela y yo lo preparábamos cuando aún vivía.

translation.en: We even grew all the herbs and veggies ourselves.
Anyways, I smelled doro wat,
and I just so badly wanted to see my āyatē again.
translation.es: y tenía muchas ganas de volver a ver a mi ayate.

translation.en: But it wasn't her.
It was a witch,
an evil, wicked witch.
How's that for a happy ending?
[Alex] "With the fangs came the hunger, and Katie discovered that her hunch was right."
translation.es: "Con los colmillos, vino el hambre, y Katie descubrió algo:

translation.en: "To a vampire, blood does taste like candy."
translation.es: para los vampiros, la sangre es dulce".

translation.en: Everybody knows it takes two days to grow full fangs.
translation.es: Todos saben que los colmillos tardan dos días en crecer por completo.

translation.en: You're stupid.
[Alex] Here, Lenore, a peace offering.
[mutters] Story.
There's gotta be more writing from that Unicorn Girl.
translation.es: La Niña Unicornio debe haber escrito más.

translation.en: "…but it's too late. The roller coaster plunges down the drop."
translation.es: "Ya es tarde. La montaña rusa cae.

translation.en: "Steel snaps, metal shrieks,
translation.es: El acero se quiebra, el metal chirría,

translation.en: humans scream,
and the grim reaper's dog laughs at the carnage."
translation.es: y el perro de la Parca se ríe de la matanza".

translation.en: The grim reaper doesn't have a pet.
Isn't that right, Lenore?
This is gonna take forever!
"They saw their son's footprints in the snow, leading into the woods."
translation.es: "Las huellas de su hijo se dirigían al bosque.

translation.en: "Then they saw a pair of smaller footprints, teddy-bear-sized."
translation.es: Luego vieron unas más pequeñas, del tamaño de un oso de peluche.

translation.en: "And they never saw their precious son again."
translation.es: Nunca volvieron a ver a su hijo".

translation.en: [Natacha] Possessed teddy bears? Really? Took me right out of the story.
translation.es: ¿Ositos de peluche poseídos? ¿En serio? Me hizo perder el interés.

translation.en: Every good story hints at truth.
translation.es: Toda buena historia tiene algo de verdad.

translation.en: The more truth, the more powerful the story.
translation.es: Cuanto más realista, más impactante es.

translation.en: From now on, get your facts straight.
translation.es: De ahora en adelante, usa datos verídicos.

translation.en: Yes!
"I don't know how long I've been here." "I still have the necklace Mom and Dad gave me."
translation.es: "No sé cuánto tiempo llevo aquí. Tengo el collar que me dieron mis papás.

translation.en: "I used to touch it to remember them, but I stopped."
translation.es: Solía tocarlo para recordarlos, pero ya no lo hago.

translation.en: "It made me cry." "I'm tired of crying."
translation.es: Me hacía llorar. Estoy cansada de llorar".

translation.en: "I have what I need to escape tonight." "I'm finally going to see them again, Mom and Dad."
translation.es: "Tengo lo que necesito para huir. Volveré a ver a mamá y papá.

translation.en: "I wonder if they'll even know me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.es: ¿Me reconocerán? ¿Se puede olvidar a un hijo?".

translation.en: -"Escape"? -[Yasmin] Alex?
Oh my God! [gasps]
You did not just throw a book at me! Uh, no. You just surprised me. I dropped it.
translation.es: - ¿Me acabas de tirar un libro? - No. Me sorprendiste y se me cayó.

translation.en: Hold on. I'm coming down.
Hey, Yasmin, wait until you see what I found.
translation.es: Oye, Yasmin, tienes que ver lo que encontré.

translation.en: Hey, what's wrong?
This is Natacha's night nursery. Night nursery?
Yeah. Sunlight is bad for magical plants.
translation.es: Sí. El sol daña las plantas mágicas.

translation.en: Come on.
What's all this for?
Ingredients mostly, for Natacha's potions.
Don't touch anything.
What's that?
Demon silk. Enough questions. Help me with this.
translation.es: Telaraña maligna. Basta de preguntas. Ayúdame.

translation.en: I watered the vine with rat's blood instead of bat's blood.
translation.es: Regué la vid con sangre de rata. Ahora tiene huevos de destructor.

translation.en: Now, Shredder eggs are growing on it. If one of them hatches,
translation.es: Regué la vid con sangre de rata. Ahora tiene huevos de destructor. Si uno nace, destruirá el vivero y Natacha me matará.

translation.en: it can destroy the night nursery, and Natacha will kill me.
translation.es: Si uno nace, destruirá el vivero y Natacha me matará.

translation.en: -[Yasmin] I'm taking care of it, Lenore. -[meows]
[whispering] Okay. Put it gently on the ground.
translation.es: Bien. Apóyalo con cuidado en el suelo.

translation.en: Be careful. Don't jostle it. Be careful.
translation.es: Ten cuidado, no lo sacudas. Ten cuidado.

translation.en: Okay, now what?
Stomp it as hard as you can.
Good.
[Alex] Where's the blue mist come from? Do you make it? The mist, do you think it keeps Natacha young?
translation.es: ¿Qué es el espray azul? ¿Lo haces tú? ¿Crees que la mantiene joven?

translation.en: It's none of our business.
I mean, she's really pretty, but her books are ancient, and the apartment looks like a granny decorated it.
translation.es: Es bonita, pero tiene libros muy antiguos y un departamento de abuela.

translation.en: [Alex, distorted] No!
I thought for sure it was gonna--
-[panting] -[Yasmin] Did you get it?
It's getting away!
-No! No! -No!
It's cutting down the Shredder eggs! Stomp on them!
Sorry.
That's all the Shredder eggs.
[Yasmin] There it is! Don't let it get away!
[gasps] Alex, look out!
Thanks, Yas. [spluttering] I mean, Yasmin.
Wait. Where is it?
We need to find it and kill it before it destroys the whole place.
translation.es: Matémoslo antes de que destruya todo.

translation.en: [scoffs] Well, that's just great!
[Alex] Get it off me!
[yelps] Oh God!
I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay.
[Yasmin] It's gone.
I don't know where it went. [breathes shakily]
Let's go!
-Come on! -Wait.
[Alex] Gotcha.
Now let's get out of here.
You useless little twits.
You've been misbehaving in my garden.
translation.es: Se estuvieron portando mal en mi jardín.

translation.en: This will hurt you far more than it hurts me. [chuckles]
translation.es: Esto les dolerá mucho más a ustedes que a mí.

translation.en: [crying] Please, I… I can explain.
[Natacha] And I would let you
if I cared.
Do try to keep your eyes open. I would hate to have to start over.
translation.es: Intenten no cerrar los ojos. Odiaría tener que empezar de nuevo.

translation.en: [distorted] Can't you do anything right? I said keep your eyes open!
translation.es: ¿No puedes hacer nada bien? ¡Dije que no cierres los ojos!

translation.en: It was my fault!
I begged Yasmin to take me to the nursery.
I thought the creepy plants might help me think of something cool to write about.
translation.es: Pensé que las plantas extrañas me inspirarían.

translation.en: She made me promise not to touch anything, but I did.
translation.es: Me dijo que no tocara nada, pero lo hice.

translation.en: Don't hurt her. Please.
That is very brave of you, Storyteller,
to lie right to my face.
I almost killed you.
If I didn't need you to clean up the mess, I would've. No more chances.
translation.es: Pero necesito que limpies. Ya no habrá más oportunidades.

translation.en: Yas, you okay?
Look,
I'm sorry I got you involved.
From now on, you help yourself. I'll help myself.
translation.es: De ahora en más, nos las arreglaremos solos.

translation.en: [spluttering] Yas, we can get out of here, together.
translation.es: Yas, podemos salir de aquí juntos.

translation.en: It's not Yas.
It's Yasmin.
-[screeching] -Shredder!
[grunts] Gotcha!
-[Shredder screeching] -[Alex] Here we go. Okay.
One…
[breathing heavily] …two,
three!
Get… get off me! Get off me! Get off!
-[screeching] -[Alex] No! No! No!
No! No! No! No! No! No! No!
Ugh! My Nightbooks.
-[Alex] Watch out. -[Lenore meows]
Lenore's here somewhere.
-She's hurting. -[Yasmin] You look terrible.
-You've been here all night? -Yeah, all night. [sighs]
I made this. It'll help with the scrapes and cuts.
translation.es: Preparé esto para los rasguños y cortes.

translation.en: You made this for me?
Yeah, it's my own concoction. It's a kind of aloe from a harpy plant, some dried corpse-hair vine.
translation.es: Sí, lo inventé yo. Aloe de planta arpía y enredadera de pelo de cadáver.

translation.en: That's good. Really good.
Thanks.
Uh, Lenore?
-Come here. -[Lenore meows]
Look what Yas made for us. Didn't make it for her.
translation.es: - Yas nos hizo algo. - No era para ella.

translation.en: [Alex] There you go, all better. It's okay. Here we go.
translation.es: Listo, está mucho mejor. Todo está bien. Ya está.

translation.en: No.
I'm in trouble.
I… I… I don't have any stories.
What do you mean you don't have any? You said you had a bunch of them. I did, but a Shredder, it got into my room.
translation.es: - ¿Cómo que no? Tenías muchos. - Sí, pero un destructor entró al cuarto.

translation.en: And I killed it, but it destroyed all of my Nightbooks, except for this one.
translation.es: Y lo maté, pero destruyó todas mis libretas, excepto esta.

translation.en: I was reading to Natacha from those Nightbooks.
translation.es: Eso era lo que le leía a Natacha.

translation.en: I've got nothing now. I… I have to escape. I have no choice!
translation.es: Ahora no tengo nada. Debo escapar. ¡No tengo opción!

translation.en: There are two ways out. The front door where you came in and the back door--
translation.es: Hay dos salidas: la puerta principal y la trasera…

translation.en: The back door! It goes outside. I saw Natacha go through there. There's--
translation.es: ¡La trasera! Da al exterior. Vi a Natacha usarla.

translation.en: But Natacha's the only one that has the keys to that door.
translation.es: Pero solo ella tiene las llaves.

translation.en: You need to get over this escape nonsense and write something.
translation.es: - Olvida esto y escribe algo. - ¡Eso intento!

translation.en: -I've been trying! -Try harder!
translation.es: - Olvida esto y escribe algo. - ¡Eso intento! - ¡Esfuérzate más! - ¡No puedo!

translation.en: I can't write!
-[sighs] -Look, Natacha will find out tonight.
translation.es: Natacha lo descubrirá hoy. Ya no seré útil y me matará.

translation.en: -I'll be useless to her. She'll kill me. -She won't just kill you.
translation.es: Natacha lo descubrirá hoy. Ya no seré útil y me matará. No solo te matará.

translation.en: There were four of us.
Eli, Little Hwan, Claire,
and me.
Hwan was too young, but the rest of us took turns reading to Natacha.
translation.es: Hwan era muy chico. Los demás nos turnábamos para leer.

translation.en: Afterwards, we'd all huddle together at night
translation.es: A la noche, nos acurrucábamos juntos

translation.en: and dream about escaping.
[hesitates] You're saying these are…
Last night, I almost joined them.
translation.es: Ayer casi me uno a ellos.

translation.en: One day, the kitchen sink got clogged. Natacha's magic couldn't fix it.
translation.es: Un día, el fregadero se tapó. Natacha no podía arreglarlo con magia.

translation.en: That's because I blocked the pipe myself with starstell moss.
translation.es: Yo había bloqueado la tubería con musgo estelar.

translation.en: The moss resists magic.
[crying] I wanted to force Natacha to call the plumber.
translation.es: Quería forzarla a llamar al plomero.

translation.en: I taped a note under the sink for him to find, begging him to get help.
translation.es: Pegué una nota debajo del fregadero en la que pedía ayuda.

translation.en: But…
he never came.
Natacha found the note, didn't she?
Claire spent her last moments convincing Natacha that she did it…
translation.es: Claire convenció a Natacha de que había sido ella…

translation.en: not me.
Claire lied to save me.
Like… you did.
'Cause that's what friends do.
[breathes shakily] I used to love writing scary stories, but then I decided to stop.
translation.es: Me encantaba escribir cuentos de terror, pero luego decidí dejar de hacerlo.

translation.en: And now that I have to write…
translation.es: Y ahora que tengo que escribir…

translation.en: the… the ideas won't come to me anymore.
Did Hwan wear a watch?
[Yasmin] Yeah. A big, blue plastic one. Why?
-And Claire, those earrings? -[Yasmin] They were her aunt's.
translation.es: ¿Y Claire tenía esos aretes? Eran de su tía.

translation.en: Why?
There's a way out of this place.
-"I have what I need to escape tonight." -"Escape," Yasmin.
"I'm finally gonna see them again, Mom and Dad."
translation.es: "Volveré a ver a mamá y papá.

translation.en: "I wonder if they'll remember me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.es: ¿Me reconocerán? ¿Se puede olvidar a un hijo?".

translation.en: Unicorn Girl never took this off, and none of the kids in the cabinet are wearing it.
translation.es: La niña nunca se quitaba esto, y ninguno de esos niños lo tiene.

translation.en: You're right. And if she's not in the cabinet, then--
translation.es: Tienes razón. Si no está en la vitrina…

translation.en: She did it. She escaped.
translation.es: Lo logró. Huyó. Estuve juntando sus notas. Están por todas partes.

translation.en: I've been piecing together her notes. There are bits here and there.
translation.es: Huyó. Estuve juntando sus notas. Están por todas partes.

translation.en: She hid them throughout the books, so in case Natacha found out-- She wouldn't know her full plan.
translation.es: - Así, si Natacha las veía… - No descubriría todo el plan.

translation.en: Okay, what's your plan?
Your plan sucks. We're not gonna find this today.
translation.es: Tu plan es horrible. No encontraremos esto hoy. Debes escribir. Ya.

translation.en: You need to write a story for tonight. -Like right now. -[Alex sighs]
translation.es: No encontraremos esto hoy. Debes escribir. Ya.

translation.en: What do we do?
It'd take, like, a thousand years to search all these books.
translation.es: Llevará mil años revisar todos estos libros.

translation.en: A thousand years.
The thousand-year-old book.
The pen marks in the old book!
Come on. Please be here.
translation.es: Vamos. Por favor, que esté aquí.

translation.en: Is this the original "Hansel and Gretel"? [Alex] Grimm's Fairy Tales.
translation.es: - ¿"Hansel y Gretel"? - Cuentos de los hermanos Grimm.

translation.en: [Yasmin] That's totally unrealistic. No one would just eat candy off of a strange house.
translation.es: Es poco realista. Nadie comería dulces de una casa extraña.

translation.en: [gasps] I was right! More writing! [Yasmin] It's a recipe for a sleeping potion.
translation.es: - ¡Más notas! - Es una poción para dormir.

translation.en: "It smells awful." "I need to figure out how to hide the stink so she'll drink it."
translation.es: "Huele horrible. Debo descubrir cómo ocultar el hedor.

translation.en: "I'm so close. I'll put her to sleep and steal her keys."
translation.es: Falta poco. La dormiré y robaré la llave.

translation.en: "I wish I had magic." "I'd turn her into a toad or a snail and laugh at her all day long."
translation.es: Si pudiera hacer magia, la convertiría en un sapo por diversión.

translation.en: "Then I would turn her into a centipede and rip off her legs." "All hundred legs,
translation.es: Luego la convertiría en un ciempiés y le arrancaría las cien patas

translation.en: one at a time."
I'll keep looking. You have to write a story.
[hesitates] I don't think I can.
You're the only one who can. You've gotta buy us more time.
translation.es: Solo tú puedes ganar más tiempo.

translation.en: You don't think I'm weird?
That I…
I like to write scary stories?
Weird?
Who called you that?
Well, they're right. You are weird.
I mean, look at you.
But the thing that makes you weird makes them ordinary.
translation.es: Pero lo que te hace raro a ellos los hace ordinarios.

translation.en: And no one likes to be ordinary. Ordinary sucks.
translation.es: Nadie quiere ser uno más, es malísimo.

translation.en: So ordinary people are gonna try and take that away from you…
translation.es: Así que tratarán de quitarte esto…

translation.en: by calling you names like
-Tryhard or-- -Creepshow.
Yeah, or Creepshow.
Thanks, Yasmin.
It's Yas.
Do you have those ingredients? [Yasmin] Yeah. Yeah, I do.
But she's right. Suckleweed stinks.
How did she mask the smell? She must've found another ingredient.
translation.es: - ¿Cómo ocultó el olor? - Quizá con otro ingrediente.

translation.en: [Yasmin] The only other person who would know is Natacha, but she would never tell us.
translation.es: Solo Natacha podría saberlo y nunca nos lo diría.

translation.en: I do have an idea.
I could write a story to trick her into giving us the final ingredient of the sleeping potion.
translation.es: Crearé un cuento para engañarla y que diga el ingrediente.

translation.en: [Yasmin] You know what happens if she figures out what we're up to? [Alex] I know what happens if we don't try.
translation.es: - ¿Sabes qué pasará si se da cuenta? - Sé qué pasará si no lo hacemos.

translation.en: [Yasmin] What's the name of the story?
[Natacha] Not that one.
You're happy with that one.
I don't like you happy.
I want a story that'll make you squirm.
translation.es: Quiero un cuento que te haga sufrir.

translation.en: Here's the story I want.
Why burn your Nightbooks?
You thought I forgot about that, didn't you?
I was… I just… I was… [sighs]
Uh… Oh my God.
I'm so sorry. I'm so stupid. Yes, you are. I've only been saying that for years.
translation.es: - Lo siento. Soy tan tonta. - Sí. Hace años que lo digo.

translation.en: Now you get it. [sighs heavily] Where was I?
translation.es: Por fin lo entiendes. ¿En qué estaba?

translation.en: You were about to tell me to start reading. Oh yes. Well then, what are you waiting for?
translation.es: - Ibas a decirme que empezara a leer. - Ah, sí. ¿Qué esperas?

translation.en: Get on with it.
[Alex] "For generations, the evil sorcerer of Quantel sent children to mine jewels from the mouth of the great monster."
translation.es: "El malvado hechicero enviaba a niños a extraer joyas de la boca del monstruo".

translation.en: [Alex] "A thousand years ago, the evil sorcerer had a chance to kill the odious beast,
translation.es: "El hechicero tuvo la oportunidad de matar a la bestia,

translation.en: but instead he used a powerful potion to keep the monster unconscious,
translation.es: pero usó una poción para dormir al detestable monstruo

translation.en: to make himself rich."
"Odious." Good word.
[Alex] "Every morning, the sorcerer funneled his potion down the monster's fifth ear,
translation.es: "Cada mañana, vertía la poción en la quinta oreja del monstruo,

translation.en: and the beast remained unconscious."
"The recipe was as old as time."
"Dissolved rat's bones, dry-aged widow orchid, powdered beetle shells."
translation.es: Huesos de rata, orquídeas viuda secas, escarabajos en polvo.

translation.en: "But the most important ingredient, however, was bindweed."
translation.es: Pero el ingrediente más importante era la campanilla.

translation.en: "Bindweed was the only thing that could hide the powerful stench of the potion."
translation.es: Era lo único que ocultaba el hedor de la poción.

translation.en: "Without it, the rancid smell would rouse the great monster."
translation.es: Sin ella, el olor rancio despertaría al monstruo.

translation.en: "But one day, the sorcerer went to harvest more bindweed,
translation.es: Un día, el hechicero fue a buscar campanilla

translation.en: and he discovered that the entire field had withered and died."
translation.es: y descubrió que todo el campo se había marchitado.

translation.en: "The potion smelled worse than ever." "Putrid, rank, malodorous--"
translation.es: El olor de la poción era terrible: pútrido, nauseabundo, hediondo".

translation.en: Oh, yes, yes, yes. Understood. It stinks.
[Alex] "The sorcerer would have to kill the great monster once and for all."
translation.es: "El hechicero tendría que matar al monstruo de una vez por todas.

translation.en: "He reluctantly raised his mighty staff to kill the beast,
translation.es: Levantó de mala gana su bastón para matarlo,

translation.en: but a peasant girl came to him and promised a solution to his problem."
translation.es: pero una niña se acercó con una solución.

translation.en: I know a replacement for bindweed. Your jewel harvest can continue.
Foolish child. You know nothing of real magic.
translation.es: 'Niña tonta. No sabes nada de magia'.

translation.en: I can prove it. And if I do, I want a bag of jewels.
translation.es: 'Lo probaré, pero quiero una bolsa de joyas'.

translation.en: If it works, you will get two bags.
If not, you will give me your life.
translation.es: Si no, me darás tu vida'.

translation.en: [Alex] "The peasant girl stepped forward and poured a mysterious dark liquid into the jug."
translation.es: La niña se acercó y vertió un líquido oscuro en la jarra.

translation.en: "The evil sorcerer sniffed the potion."
"The smell disappeared. The sorcerer couldn't believe it."
"It smelled like daisies, roses, lilacs on a spring morning--"
translation.es: Olía a margaritas, rosas, lilas en primavera…

translation.en: [Alex] "The evil sorcerer poured the potion into the monster's ear and waited."
translation.es: El hechicero le dio la poción al monstruo y esperó.

translation.en: "The beast let out a long… [in low voice] …grumble then went still again."
translation.es: La bestia soltó un largo gruñido y se quedó quieta otra vez.

translation.en: "Yes! But the peasant girl had removed more than just the smell from the potion."
translation.es: '¡Sí!'. Pero la campesina no solo había eliminado el olor.

translation.en: "She'd also erased all of its magic."
"The sorcerer's potion was rendered useless."
translation.es: La poción del hechicero era inútil.

translation.en: "The peasant girl nodded to something behind him."
[Alex] "The eyes of the great monster were open."
translation.es: El monstruo tenía los ojos abiertos.

translation.en: "The sorcerer shrieked." [Alex] "The peasant girl watched it all, smiling."
translation.es: El hechicero gritó. La campesina vio todo con una sonrisa.

translation.en: "The evil sorcerer had sent her baby brother into that cave, and he never returned."
translation.es: El hechicero había enviado a su hermanito a la cueva y nunca había regresado.

translation.en: "The peasant girl cared nothing about jewels." "She got what she wanted, revenge."
translation.es: La niña no quería joyas. Solo quería vengarse.

translation.en: "And so she walked away as the monster's sharp teeth chomped down on the shrieking sorcerer,
translation.es: Y se alejó mientras esos afilados dientes mordían al hechicero

translation.en: silencing him forever."
"Just as the peasant girl thought she'd gotten away with it all, a black shadow loomed over her."
translation.es: La niña pensó que lo había logrado, pero una sombra se alzó sobre ella.

translation.en: "It was the monster's giant foot, right above her."
translation.es: Era el pie gigante del monstruo.

translation.en: -"Splat." -[meows]
"The end."
"And not a happy one."
Bindweed?
Yeah, me and Yasmin researched for hours. I know how important it is to get all the details right--
translation.es: Sí, investigamos mucho. Sé que los detalles deben ser correctos…

translation.en: -[Natacha] No. -No?
Of course I made up the potion's ingredients,
but I was sure that bindweed hides odors.
translation.es: pero estaba segura de que la campanilla oculta olores.

translation.en: -I really thought we got it right. -Well, there's your mistake. You worked with her.
translation.es: - Creí que era así. - Ese fue tu error. Trabajaste con ella.

translation.en: Bindweed keeps liquid from separating.
translation.es: La campanilla evita que el líquido se separe.

translation.en: Everyone knows cinaroot hides smells,
translation.es: Todos saben que la canerraíz esconde olores,

translation.en: not bindweed.
Cinaroot, of course.
Is that cinaroot with an "S" or a "C"?
translation.es: ¿Se escribe con C o con K?

translation.en: Okay.
Let's do some science stuff.
Tonight, we're getting out of here.
[Alex] Good night, Natacha.
Oh my God. What's happening?
translation.es: Dios mío. ¿Qué pasó? Se está poniendo verde.

translation.en: It's turning green. I can't bring this out there.
translation.es: Dios mío. ¿Qué pasó? Se está poniendo verde. No puedo llevar esto.

translation.en: Some kind of reaction?
Maybe the acidity of the lemonade-- The service here is terrible. [sighs]
translation.es: - La acidez del limón… - Pésimo servicio.

translation.en: I don't have a story. We put two drops in the glass.
translation.es: - No tengo cuentos. - Pongamos dos gotas en la jarra.

translation.en: -Let's put two in the pitcher. -Will it put her to sleep?
translation.es: - No tengo cuentos. - Pongamos dos gotas en la jarra. ¿Alcanzará?

translation.en: Where is my lemonade? It's coming!
What? I put it right here.
-Where is it? -What are you talking about?
Where is the potion? This has to happen.
She knows.
So, uh…
So it's…
It's…
Let's see.
So, um…
Any day now, Storyteller.
Yeah, yeah. It's, uh… it's here somewhere.
Spit it out.
Oh, okay.
-I just gotta find it. -Read!
[chuckles] Here it is.
So, um, this one is, um, called "The Cuckoo Clock."
[Alex] When Scott's parents bought the cuckoo clock at an estate sale,
translation.es: Cuando los padres de Scott compraron el reloj cucú,

translation.en: he thought it was just another old-timey piece of junk.
translation.es: él pensó que solo era otra porquería antigua.

translation.en: But there was something strange about the clock.
translation.es: Pero el reloj tenía algo extraño.

translation.en: Every hour on the hour,
the little cuckoo would pop out,
and, uh, Steve started to notice--
Who's Steve?
I thought you said his name was Scott.
[laughs nervously] Sorry. Right. Uh, typo.
So… so Scott noticed that, uh, the cuckoo
seemed to look a little bit different every time it appeared.
translation.es: era diferente cada vez que aparecía.

translation.en: Like, its eyes would--
-What is this? -Uh…
Where are all your stories, the ones that you're supposed to be writing every day?
translation.es: ¿Dónde están los cuentos que debes escribir todos los días?

translation.en: -I'm sorry. I'm sorry. -Where are your new stories?
The Shredder, it got into my backpack. The Shredder ate your homework?
translation.es: - El destructor se metió en mi mochila. - ¿El destructor te comió la tarea?

translation.en: [spluttering] Uh, it's true. It escaped from the night nursery.
translation.es: Es verdad. Se escapó del vivero.

translation.en: -[distorted] Quiet, girl. -[breathing heavily]
Thorns in my side…
-[crying] No! -…since the moment you arrived.
I'll make you the recipe. I--
Please. You can barely follow a recipe.
translation.es: Por favor. A duras penas puedes seguir una receta.

translation.en: He writes for you! You need him! [spluttering] I'll write the best story for you!
Hmm, let's face it. This is long overdue.
translation.es: Aceptémoslo. Debería haber hecho esto hace tiempo.

translation.en: [Yasmin crying] Please, no! No!
What?
Don't touch her. Don't touch.
-[Alex] Lenore. -[meows, purrs]
[Alex] You okay?
What's… what's happening?
[Alex] Oh no. What's wrong with you?
[splutters] Something's wrong.
Poor little thing. What happened to you?
Lenore put our potion in the bottle of mist. [sighs] I can't believe it.
translation.es: Lenore puso la poción en el atomizador. No puedo creerlo.

translation.en: She must've gotten a dose of the sleeping potion.
She's a prisoner, just like us.
-Thank you, Lenore. -Alex, we did it.
-We beat her. -[chuckles]
How's that for following a recipe?
Wait. Where do you think it goes?
Home.
Never thought I'd see trees again.
Look.
I'm never gonna eat peanut butter ever again! [Alex] You can forget about pumpkin pie for me!
translation.es: - ¡No más mantequilla de maní! - ¡Ni pastel de calabaza!

translation.en: First food when I get back? Vanilla milkshake!
Whoa, whoa, wait, Alex. Hold up. Hold up. Just wait a second.
That's widow's grub. That's sunken lily.
translation.es: Eso es larva de viuda. Y lirio acuático.

translation.en: Why is that here?
No, no, no. Alex! Alex! Alex! Alex!
The door, it wasn't the way out.
translation.es: La puerta no era la salida.

translation.en: We're still in the apartment.
[screaming] Evil unicorn!
Run!
[Alex] Run!
[Yasmin] Alex, it's getting closer!
[Alex] It's too fast!
[Yasmin] Oh my God.
-[Alex] What just happened? -[Yasmin] Maybe something spooked it?
[Yasmin] Alex?
"Every good story hints at truth."
translation.es: "Toda buena historia tiene algo de verdad".

translation.en: Oh my God.
"Hansel and Gretel" was real.
Yas?
-[voices echoing] -We're in "Hansel--" It smells so delicious.
-Yas? -[chuckles]
So hungry.
Yas!
We… we shouldn't be in here, Yas.
Yas?
Hello?
Yas, what's wrong with you?
Yas?
Yas?
Lenore?
Yasmin?
[echoing] Hello?
Yasmin!
Yasmin!
I'm… I'm okay.
This is probably fine.
-Well, well, well! -[gasps] Sleeping Beauty awakes.
translation.es: Vaya, vaya. La bella durmiente se despertó.

translation.en: Oh, wait. Wrong story.
-Alex! -[Alex gasps]
-[Alex] Are you guys okay? -[Yasmin] Yeah.
We're okay.
The mist, that's where it comes from.
translation.es: El espray azul viene de ahí.

translation.en: You're harvesting it. Who's inside that coffin?
translation.es: Lo estás extrayendo. ¿Quién está dentro de ese ataúd?

translation.en: [distorted] The original witch,
who, by the way, does eat children.
translation.es: Quien, por cierto, de verdad come niños.

translation.en: We thought you were the original witch. We thought the blue mist kept you young.
translation.es: Creíamos que eras tú y que el espray te mantenía joven.

translation.en: I don't need the mist to keep me young.
translation.es: No necesito el espray para eso.

translation.en: It gives me her magic.
What?
How?
I was about your age when she got me. There were lots of us back then.
translation.es: Tenía tu edad cuando me atrapó. Éramos muchos en ese entonces.

translation.en: But we weren't dumb.
We knew not to get attached, because she got hungry.
translation.es: Sabíamos que no debíamos encariñarnos porque ella tenía hambre.

translation.en: She ate them?
Yes.
All of them.
[Natacha] And then I… I had to clean the oven.
translation.es: Y yo tuve que limpiar el horno.

translation.en: I pretended to like her. Pretended to want to be like her.
translation.es: Le hice creer que me caía bien, que quería ser como ella.

translation.en: I became her favorite.
But when I was alone, I plotted my escape.
translation.es: Pero, cuando estaba sola, planeaba mi escape.

translation.en: I would get her to trust me.
And then, a sleeping potion,
translation.es: Y luego, una poción para dormir,

translation.en: and I would be free.
I ran straight home…
but my parents were gone.
They left you.
[Natacha] I had nowhere else to go, so I came back here.
translation.es: No tenía adónde ir, así que regresé.

translation.en: [Natacha] Who cares about them?
You were just like us.
Wait.
The sleeping potion…
You're Unicorn Girl.
You read my diaries.
Did you meet my pet? The unicorn?
That's your pet? I made him.
I make many things now.
[Alex] She's the one who's been shaking the apartment?
[Natacha] If she doesn't get a story, we're all gonna die.
translation.es: Si no le cuentan una historia, todos moriremos.

translation.en: Stories keep her asleep.
Stories of fear and suffering and death are like sweet lullabies to her.
translation.es: Los cuentos de miedo, sufrimiento y muerte son sus canciones de cuna.

translation.en: -Tell one. -[witch growling] I don't have a story.
translation.es: - Cuenta uno. - No tengo un cuento.

translation.en: Oh, yes, you do.
Tell us the reason that you wanted to destroy your Nightbooks.
translation.es: Cuenta por qué querías destruir tus libretas.

translation.en: -[rumbling subsides] -But… [exhales] …that's not scary--
[Natacha] It was, to you.
All that pain and fear and sadness
translation.es: Todo ese dolor, miedo y tristeza

translation.en: that you've been avoiding this whole time.
translation.es: que estuviste evitando todo este tiempo.

translation.en: Tell it!
Now, Alex!
You think I'm a bad witch? Just wait until she wakes up and sees you.
translation.es: ¿Crees que soy una bruja mala? Espera a que despierte y te vea.

translation.en: So young, so plump, so juicy--
Okay! Okay!
[Alex] There once was a boy who… who loved to write scary stories.
translation.es: Había un niño que adoraba escribir cuentos de terror.

translation.en: Every day, on his free time, he would come up with new ways to scare his classmates.
translation.es: Todos los días, inventaba nuevas formas de asustar a sus compañeros.

translation.en: But… [sighs] …they just didn't get his fascination with creepy things.
translation.es: Pero ellos no entendían su fascinación por las cosas espeluznantes.

translation.en: To them, he was just… weird.
"What's wrong with you?" they'd ask. Many of them were cruel,
translation.es: "¿Qué problema tienes?", decían. Muchos eran crueles.

translation.en: calling him names, like Creepshow.
Except for Joshua.
Josh was his best friend since kindergarten.
translation.es: Josh era su mejor amigo desde el jardín de infantes.

translation.en: Alex finishes his latest bone-chilling tale,
translation.es: Alex terminó un cuento aterrador y quería compartirlo.

translation.en: and he's excited to share it.
translation.es: Alex terminó un cuento aterrador y quería compartirlo. FIN… ¿O NO?

translation.en: Hey, you're gonna love this one.
Josh?
Hey, Josh?
[Alex] Alex catches up with Josh after class.
translation.es: Alex lo alcanzó después de clase.

translation.en: Wait. My birthday's tonight.
We turned the apartment into a haunted house. It's amazing. I've got tons of new stories ready.
translation.es: Decoramos toda mi casa, quedó increíble. Y escribí muchos cuentos".

translation.en: Josh talks low, not wanting the others to hear.
translation.es: Josh hablaba bajo para que no los escucharan.

translation.en: Cody's having a gaming party. His dad's getting the truck and everything.
translation.es: "Cody hará una fiesta de videojuegos. Alquiló un camión".

translation.en: But to… tonight's my party.
…says Alex, confused and hurt.
Alex's hope sinks. He's desperate. He says…
translation.es: Alex perdió toda esperanza. Desesperado, dijo:

translation.en: You're my best friend.
Josh tries to be gentle.
Yeah, right.
Cody's my friend now too. And you're just not…
translation.es: "Cody también es mi amigo. Y tú no…

translation.en: [laughs] Come on.
The way you dress, the things you like. "All you do is talk about your scary stories."
translation.es: Tu ropa, las cosas que te gustan… Solo hablas de tus cuentos de terror.

translation.en: Everyone thinks it's weird.
[Alex] That's when Cody butts in.
Yo, Josh, you comin'?
Come on, J-Man.
All right, all right. Alex, I'll see you later, okay?
The boy had written a new story about a haunted house.
translation.es: Había escrito un cuento sobre una casa embrujada.

translation.en: [crying] He, his mom, and his dad had turned his whole apartment into that house.
translation.es: Él, su mamá y su papá habían convertido todo el departamento en esa casa.

translation.en: No one showed up…
not even Josh.
They made him hate the thing he loved most.
translation.es: Le hicieron odiar lo que más amaba.

translation.en: And they made him hate himself.
translation.es: Y lo hicieron odiarse a sí mismo.

translation.en: The real truth is, he was embarrassed to be himself,
translation.es: La realidad es que estaba avergonzado,

translation.en: so he decided to burn his Nightbooks.
translation.es: así que decidió quemar sus cuentos.

translation.en: He swore he'd never write another story again.
translation.es: Juró que nunca volvería a escribir.

translation.en: He could be a new person.
Not weird.
Not a freak.
He could be normal,
like Josh and his friends.
Then he wouldn't be alone.
The boy lost all his friends,
translation.es: El chico perdió a todos sus amigos

translation.en: so he decided to destroy that part of himself that created the Nightbooks.
translation.es: y decidió destruir al niño que había escrito esos cuentos.

translation.en: Then a witch captured him. She said she liked his stories.
translation.es: Luego una bruja lo capturó. Decía que le gustaban sus historias.

translation.en: The witch was lying.
But being captured by her was the best thing that ever happened to me…
translation.es: Pero que me capturara fue lo mejor que me pasó…

translation.en: …because I made new friends,
friends who love me for who I am, not for who they want me to be.
translation.es: Amigas que me quieren como soy. No quieren cambiarme.

translation.en: What have you done? No!
No!
-[meows] -No. -No! -This is our happy ending!
No happy endings.
-Guys, let's get out of here. -Fine.
[Natacha] No!
Oh! No! No, you idiot!
What have you done? You stupid children.
No! No!
-[witch wheezing and grunting] -[Natacha] Oh God! Oh God!
Oh God.
You're awake.
Finally.
You've been asleep here so long, the… the candy is infecting you.
translation.es: Has dormido tanto que los dulces te están infectando.

translation.en: You…
You did this to me.
I have lived in fear of you for so long, but I am not that little girl anymore.
translation.es: Te temí durante mucho tiempo, pero ya no soy esa niña.

translation.en: Witch fight!
-Let's get out of here! -Let's go!
[Yasmin] Go! Just go!
-[grunting] -[Yasmin] Go! Go!
Help! We need help! Get us out of here!
A witch is gonna eat us!
Help!
Can anyone hear me?
[Yasmin] Alex, move. I've seen Natacha do this.
translation.es: Alex, muévete. He visto a Natacha hacer esto.

translation.en: Yas?
Yasmin?
You… you did it. You did it.
-[witch] I'm home. -Let's go.
-Lenore! -[Yasmin] We gotta go.
We're still in my building. The apartment didn't move.
translation.es: Es mi edificio. No nos movimos.

translation.en: -Do you have a plan? -Not exactly a plan, an idea.
[witch] Hello, children.
I'm so hungry.
This is the worst elevator ever!
translation.es: ¡Este es el peor ascensor de todos!

translation.en: What now? We just need to make it to that boiler room.
translation.es: - ¿Y ahora? - Hay que llegar a la sala de calderas.

translation.en: You gotta be kidding me.
-No! No! No! No! -No! No! No! No!
-[witch grunting] -[screaming] No! Oh my God!
No, let… let her go. It's me you want.
-Incorrect. -[Yasmin crying]
I want both of you.
No!
No. I'm sorry. -No! -[thudding]
-[meows] -Lenore!
-No. No. -[witch growling]
"Stories about fear and death are like lullabies to her." [Yasmin] No, no, no.
translation.es: "Los cuentos de miedo son sus canciones de cuna".

translation.en: [crying] No!
No!
She's read all of them. No! [crying]
Hey, ugly.
You like stories? I got stories.
[breathes shakily] Jason couldn't decide which was stranger.
translation.es: Jason no sabía qué era más raro:

translation.en: The fact that his sister died every Tuesday at 11:15 or that she always came back to life 20 minutes later.
translation.es: que su hermana muriera todos los martes o que reviviera 20 minutos después.

translation.en: More. Give me more.
Zachary had always thought that clowns were the scariest part of the circus.
translation.es: Zach creía que el payaso era lo más aterrador del circo.

translation.en: He was wrong.
I found a package on my front porch
translation.es: Encontré un paquete en el porche

translation.en: addressed to the woman standing right behind you.
translation.es: dirigido a la mujer que está parada detrás de ti.

translation.en: Who? Who was it? Who was it?
-The stories! -[Alex] Push her! Push her in!
[Alex] Keep pushing!
[Alex] Don't let her out!
Keep it shut! Keep pushing!
-[Yasmin] Keep it shut! -[Alex] Keep her in!
-[both panting] -[Yasmin] Oh my God.
So that's why they call you a tryhard?
Shut up, Creepshow.
All right, skin-bag. We didn't forget about you. Come here.
translation.es: Bien, bolsa de piel. No nos olvidamos de ti. Ven aquí.

translation.en: Let's go home.
[Yasmin] Maybe we should take the stairs.
♪ Blind boys don't lie… ♪
Mom? Dad?
[gasps] Alex? Oh my…
You're home. Oh! [cries]
[Alex] These are my friends, Lenore and Yasmin.
translation.es: - Dios mío. - Ellas son mis amigas, Lenore y Yasmin.

translation.en: -Hi. -Yas, for short.
♪ Thou shall not die ♪ ♪ Unchain me, sister! ♪
translation.es: NIÑA DESAPARECIDA SE REÚNE CON SUS PADRES

translation.en: Oh God, you scared me.
-Hey, Creepshow. -Hey, Tryhard.
My parents drove me up to surprise you.
-What is that? Like, your third story? -Fourth, actually.
So you could definitely use this.
translation.es: Entonces esto te va a venir bien.

translation.en: Oh my God, Yas.
[Yasmin] Check out the flowers. My next science fair project. The effect of ultraviolet black light on photosynthetic organisms.
translation.es: Las flores son un proyecto: el efecto de la luz UV en organismos fotosintéticos.

translation.en: [Alex] Still don't believe in happy endings? [Yasmin] I'm starting to.
translation.es: - ¿Y los finales felices? - Quizá sí existen.
